member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Web.Util.Base64UrlHelpers.s_base64Table
member.summary: Encoding table.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.Util.Base64UrlHelpers.Encode(System.String)
member.summary: The following functions perform base64url encoding which differs from regular base64 encoding as follows * padding is skipped so the pad character '=' doesn't have to be percent encoded * the 62nd and 63rd regular base64 encoding characters ('+' and '/') are replace with ('-' and '_') The changes make the encoding alphabet file and URL safe.
member.param: string to encode.
member.returns: Base64Url encoding of the UTF8 bytes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.Util.Base64UrlHelpers.Encode(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a subset of an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-64-url digits. Parameters specify the subset as an offset in the input array, and the number of elements in the array to convert.
member.param: An array of 8-bit unsigned integers.
The number of elements of inArray to convert.
An offset in inArray.
member.returns: The string representation in base 64 url encoding of length elements of inArray, starting at position offset.
member.exception: offset or length is negative OR offset plus length is greater than the length of inArray.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.Util.Base64UrlHelpers.Encode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts a subset of an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-64-url digits. Parameters specify the subset as an offset in the input array, and the number of elements in the array to convert.
member.param: An array of 8-bit unsigned integers.
member.returns: The string representation in base 64 url encoding of length elements of inArray, starting at position offset.
member.exception: offset or length is negative OR offset plus length is greater than the length of inArray.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.Util.Base64UrlHelpers.DecodeBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified string, which encodes binary data as base-64-url digits, to an equivalent 8-bit unsigned integer array.
member.param: base64Url encoded string.
member.returns: UTF8 bytes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.Util.Base64UrlHelpers.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes the string from Base64UrlEncoded to UTF8.
member.param: string to decode.
member.returns: UTF8 string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.LoggingEventId
member.summary: EventIds for Logging.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions
member.summary: Options passed-in to create the token acquisition object which calls into MSAL .NET.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions.Tenant
member.summary: Enables to override the tenant/account for the same identity. This is useful in multi-tenant apps in the cases where a given account is a guest in other tenants, and you want to acquire tokens for a specific tenant.
member.remarks: Can be the tenant ID or domain name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions.UserFlow
member.summary: Uses a particular user flow (in the case of AzureAD B2C)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions.CorrelationId
member.summary: Sets the correlation id to be used in the authentication request to the /token endpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions.ExtraQueryParameters
member.summary: Sets Extra Query Parameters for the query string in the HTTP authentication request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions.Claims
member.summary: A string with one or multiple claims to request. Normally used with Conditional Access.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions.ForceRefresh
member.summary: Specifies if the token request will ignore the access token in the token cache and will attempt to acquire a new access token. If true, the request will ignore the token cache. The default is false. Use this option with care and only when needed, for instance, if you know that conditional access policies have changed, for it induces performance degradation, as the token cache is not utilized.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions.PoPConfiguration
member.summary: Modifies the token acquisition request so that the acquired token is a Proof of Possession token (PoP), rather than a Bearer token. PoP tokens are similar to Bearer tokens, but are bound to the HTTP request and to a cryptographic key, which MSAL can manage. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-pop.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions.CancellationToken
member.summary: Cancellation token to be used when calling the token acquisition methods.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions.LongRunningWebApiSessionKey
member.summary: Key used for long running web APIs that need to call downstream web APIs on behalf of the user. Can be null, if you are not developing a long running web API, if you want Microsoft.Identity.Web to allocate a session key for you, or your own string if you want to associate the session with some information you have externally (for instance a Microsoft Graph hook identifier).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions.LongRunningWebApiSessionKeyAuto
member.summary: Value that can be used for so that MSAL.NET allocates the long running web api session key for the developer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions.Clone
member.summary: Clone the options (to be able to override them).
member.returns: A clone of the options.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.OpenIdConnectOptions
member.summary: OpenIdConnect options

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.OpenIdConnectOptions.Authority
member.summary: Gets or sets the Authority to use when making OpenIdConnect calls.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.OpenIdConnectOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: Client secret used to authenticate a confidential client app to AAD (alternatively use client certificates)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.OpenIdConnectOptions.ClientId
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'client_id' (application ID) as appears in the application registration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions
member.summary: Options for configuring authentication using Azure Active Directory. It has both AAD and B2C configuration attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.Instance
member.summary: Gets or sets the Azure Active Directory instance, e.g. "https://login.microsoftonline.com".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.TenantId
member.summary: Gets or sets the tenant ID.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.Domain
member.summary: Gets or sets the domain of the Azure Active Directory tenant, e.g. contoso.onmicrosoft.com.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.EditProfilePolicyId
member.summary: Gets or sets the edit profile user flow name for B2C, e.g. b2c_1_edit_profile.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.SignUpSignInPolicyId
member.summary: Gets or sets the sign up or sign in user flow name for B2C, e.g. b2c_1_susi.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.ResetPasswordPolicyId
member.summary: Gets or sets the reset password user flow name for B2C, e.g. B2C_1_password_reset.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.DefaultUserFlow
member.summary: Gets the default user flow (which is signUpsignIn).

members.member:
Enables legacy ADAL cache serialization and deserialization. Performance improvements when working with MSAL only apps. Set to true if you have a shared cache with ADAL apps.
The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.IsB2C
member.summary: Is considered B2C if the attribute SignUpSignInPolicyId is defined.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.HasClientCredentials
member.summary: Is considered to have client credentials if the attribute ClientCertificates or ClientSecret is defined.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.ClientCertificates
member.summary: Description of the certificates used to prove the identity of the web app or web API.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.TokenDecryptionCertificates
member.summary: Description of the certificates used to decrypt an encrypted token in a web API.

members.member:
Specifies if the x5c claim (public key of the certificate) should be sent to the STS. Sending the x5c enables application developers to achieve easy certificate rollover in Azure AD: this method will send the public certificate to Azure AD along with the token request, so that Azure AD can use it to validate the subject name based on a trusted issuer policy. This saves the application admin from the need to explicitly manage the certificate rollover (either via portal or PowerShell/CLI operation). For details see https://aka.ms/msal-net-sni.
The default is false.

Requests an auth code for the frontend (SPA using MSAL.js for instance). See https://aka.ms/msal-net/spa-auth-code for details.
The default is false.

Daemon applications can validate a token based on roles, or using the ACL-based authorization pattern to control tokens without a roles claim. If using ACL-based authorization, Microsoft Identity Web will not throw if roles or scopes are not in the Claims. For details see https://aka.ms/ms-identity-web/daemon-ACL.
The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.UserAssignedManagedIdentityClientId
member.summary: Used, when deployed to Azure, to specify explicitly a user assigned managed identity. See https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/managed-identities-azure-resources/how-to-manage-ua-identity-portal.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.ResetPasswordPath
member.summary: Sets the ResetPassword route path. Defaults to /MicrosoftIdentity/Account/ResetPassword, which is the value used by Microsoft.Identity.Web.UI.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftIdentityOptions.ErrorPath
member.summary: Sets the Error route path. Defaults to the value /MicrosoftIdentity/Account/Error, which is the value used by Microsoft.Identity.Web.UI.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.MergedOptions
member.summary: Options for configuring authentication using Azure Active Directory. It has both AAD and B2C configuration attributes. Merges the MicrosoftIdentityWebOptions and the ConfidentialClientApplicationOptions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ITokenAcquisitionInternal
member.summary: Interface for the internal operations of token acquisition service (encapsulating MSAL.NET).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ITokenAcquisitionInternal.AddAccountToCacheFromAuthorizationCodeAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: In a web app, adds, to the MSAL.NET cache, the account of the user authenticating to the web app, when the authorization code is received (after the user signed-in and consented) the token redeemed from the "/> is added to the cache, so that it can then be used to acquire another token on-behalf-of the same user in order to call to downstream APIs.
member.param: Scopes to request. Can be empty
Authorization code
Authentication scheme to use (config section)
Client Info obtained with the code
PKCE code verifier
User flow in the case of B2C
member.returns: The ID Token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ITokenAcquisitionInternal.RemoveAccountAsync(System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal,System.String)
member.summary: Removes the account associated with context.HttpContext.User from the MSAL.NET cache.
member.param: Signed in user
Authentication scheme. If null, will use OpenIdConnectDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web app, and JwtBearerDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web APIs.
member.returns: A that represents a completed remove from cache operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ITokenAcquisition
member.summary: Interface for the token acquisition service (encapsulating MSAL.NET).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ITokenAcquisition.GetAccessTokenForUserAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal,Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions)
member.summary: Typically used from an ASP.NET Core web app or web API controller. This method gets an access token for a downstream API on behalf of the user account for which the claims are provided in the current user
member.param: Scopes to request for the downstream API to call.
Authentication scheme. If null, will use OpenIdConnectDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web app, and JwtBearerDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web API.
Enables to override the tenant/account for the same identity. This is useful in the cases where a given account is guest in other tenants, and you want to acquire tokens for a specific tenant.
Azure AD B2C UserFlow to target.

Optional claims principal representing the user. If not provided, will use the signed-in user (in a web app), or the user for which the token was received (in a web API) cases where a given account is guest in other tenants, and you want to acquire tokens for a specific tenant, like where the user is a guest in.
Options passed-in to create the token acquisition object which calls into MSAL .NET.
member.returns: An access token to call on behalf of the user, the downstream API characterized by its scopes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ITokenAcquisition.GetAuthenticationResultForUserAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal,Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions)
member.summary: Typically used from an ASP.NET Core web app or web API controller. This method gets an access token for a downstream API on behalf of the user account for which the claims are provided in the current user
member.param: Scopes to request for the downstream API to call.
Authentication scheme. If null, will use OpenIdConnectDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web app, and JwtBearerDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web APIs.
Enables to override the tenant/account for the same identity. This is useful in the cases where a given account is a guest in other tenants, and you want to acquire tokens for a specific tenant.
Azure AD B2C UserFlow to target.

Optional claims principal representing the user. If not provided, will use the signed-in user (in a web app), or the user for which the token was received (in a web API) cases where a given account is a guest in other tenants, and you want to acquire tokens for a specific tenant, like where the user is a guest in.
Options passed-in to create the token acquisition object which calls into MSAL .NET.
member.returns: An to call on behalf of the user, the downstream API characterized by its scopes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ITokenAcquisition.GetAccessTokenForAppAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions)
member.summary: Acquires a token from the authority configured in the app, for the confidential client itself (not on behalf of a user) using the client credentials flow. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-client-credentials.
member.param: The scope requested to access a protected API. For this flow (client credentials), the scope should be of the form "{ResourceIdUri/.default}" for instance https://management.azure.net/.default or, for Microsoft Graph, https://graph.microsoft.com/.default as the requested scopes are defined statically with the application registration in the portal, cannot be overridden in the application, as you can request a token for only one resource at a time (use several calls to get tokens for other resources).
Authentication scheme. If null, will use OpenIdConnectDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web app, and JwtBearerDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web API.
Enables overriding of the tenant/account for the same identity. This is useful in the cases where a given account is a guest in other tenants, and you want to acquire tokens for a specific tenant.
Options passed-in to create the token acquisition object which calls into MSAL .NET.
member.returns: An access token for the app itself, based on its scopes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ITokenAcquisition.GetAuthenticationResultForAppAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions)
member.summary: Acquires an authentication result from the authority configured in the app, for the confidential client itself (not on behalf of a user) using the client credentials flow. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-client-credentials.
member.param: The scope requested to access a protected API. For this flow (client credentials), the scope should be of the form "{ResourceIdUri/.default}" for instance https://management.azure.net/.default or, for Microsoft Graph, https://graph.microsoft.com/.default as the requested scopes are defined statically with the application registration in the portal, and cannot be overridden in the application, as you can request a token for only one resource at a time (use several calls to get tokens for other resources).
Authentication scheme. If null, will use OpenIdConnectDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web app, and JwtBearerDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web API.
Enables overriding of the tenant/account for the same identity. This is useful for multi tenant apps or daemons.
Options passed-in to create the token acquisition object which calls into MSAL .NET.
member.returns: An authentication result for the app itself, based on its scopes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.ITokenAcquisition.GetEffectiveAuthenticationScheme(System.String)
member.summary: Get the effective authentication scheme based on the context.
member.param: Proposed authentication scheme.
member.returns: Effective authenticationScheme which is the authentication scheme if it's not null, or otherwise OpenIdConnectDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web app, and JwtBearerDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web API.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition
member.summary: Token acquisition service.
LoggingMessage class for TokenAcquisition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition._application
member.summary: Please call GetOrBuildConfidentialClientApplication instead of accessing this field directly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition._scopesRequestedByMsal
member.summary: Scopes which are already requested by MSAL.NET. They should not be re-requested;.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition._metaTenantIdentifiers
member.summary: Meta-tenant identifiers which are not allowed in client credentials.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition.#ctor(Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenCacheProviders.IMsalTokenCacheProvider,Microsoft.Identity.Web.ITokenAcquisitionHost,System.Net.Http.IHttpClientFactory,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger{Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition},System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Constructor of the TokenAcquisition service. This requires the Azure AD Options to configure the confidential client application and a token cache provider. This constructor is called by ASP.NET Core dependency injection.
member.param: The App token cache provider.
Host of the token acquisition.
HTTP client factory.
Logger.
Service provider.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition.GetAuthenticationResultForUserAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal,Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions)
member.summary: Typically used from a web app or web API controller, this method retrieves an access token for a downstream API using; 1) the token cache (for web apps and web APIs) if a token exists in the cache 2) or the on-behalf-of flow in web APIs, for the user account that is ascertained from claims provided in the current claims principal. instance of the current HttpContext.
member.param: Scopes to request for the downstream API to call.
Authentication scheme. If null, will use OpenIdConnectDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web app, and JwtBearerDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web APIs.

Enables overriding of the tenant/account for the same identity. This is useful in the cases where a given account is a guest in other tenants, and you want to acquire tokens for a specific tenant, like where the user is a guest.
Azure AD B2C user flow to target.

Optional claims principal representing the user. If not provided, will use the signed-in user (in a web app), or the user for which the token was received (in a web API) cases where a given account is a guest in other tenants, and you want to acquire tokens for a specific tenant, like where the user is a guest.
Options passed-in to create the token acquisition options object which calls into MSAL .NET.
member.returns: An access token to call the downstream API and populated with this downstream API's scopes.
member.remarks: Calling this method from a web API supposes that you have previously called, in a method called by JwtBearerOptions.Events.OnTokenValidated, the HttpContextExtensions.StoreTokenUsedToCallWebAPI method passing the validated token (as a JwtSecurityToken). Calling it from a web app supposes that you have previously called AddAccountToCacheFromAuthorizationCodeAsync from a method called by OpenIdConnectOptions.Events.OnAuthorizationCodeReceived.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition.GetAuthenticationResultForAppAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions)
member.summary: Acquires an authentication result from the authority configured in the app, for the confidential client itself (not on behalf of a user) using the client credentials flow. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-client-credentials.
member.param: The scope requested to access a protected API. For this flow (client credentials), the scope should be of the form "{ResourceIdUri/.default}" for instance https://management.azure.net/.default or, for Microsoft Graph, https://graph.microsoft.com/.default as the requested scopes are defined statically with the application registration in the portal, and cannot be overridden in the application, as you can request a token for only one resource at a time (use several calls to get tokens for other resources).
AuthenticationScheme to use.
Enables overriding of the tenant/account for the same identity. This is useful for multi tenant apps or daemons.
Options passed-in to create the token acquisition object which calls into MSAL .NET.
member.returns: An authentication result for the app itself, based on its scopes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition.GetAccessTokenForAppAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions)
member.summary: Acquires a token from the authority configured in the app, for the confidential client itself (not on behalf of a user) using the client credentials flow. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-client-credentials.
member.param: The scope requested to access a protected API. For this flow (client credentials), the scope should be of the form "{ResourceIdUri/.default}" for instance https://management.azure.net/.default or, for Microsoft Graph, https://graph.microsoft.com/.default as the requested scopes are defined statically with the application registration in the portal, and cannot be overridden in the application, as you can request a token for only one resource at a time (use several calls to get tokens for other resources).
AuthenticationScheme to use.
Enables overriding of the tenant/account for the same identity. This is useful for multi tenant apps or daemons.
Options passed-in to create the token acquisition object which calls into MSAL .NET.
member.returns: An access token for the app itself, based on its scopes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition.GetAccessTokenForUserAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal,Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisitionOptions)
member.summary: Typically used from a web app or web API controller, this method retrieves an access token for a downstream API using; 1) the token cache (for web apps and web APIs) if a token exists in the cache 2) or the on-behalf-of flow in web APIs, for the user account that is ascertained from the claims provided in the current claims principal. instance of the current HttpContext.
member.param: Scopes to request for the downstream API to call.
Authentication scheme. If null, will use OpenIdConnectDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web app, and JwtBearerDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web API.
Enables overriding of the tenant/account for the same identity. This is useful in the cases where a given account is a guest in other tenants, and you want to acquire tokens for a specific tenant.
Azure AD B2C user flow to target.

Optional claims principal representing the user. If not provided, will use the signed-in user (in a web app), or the user for which the token was received (in a web API) cases where a given account is a guest in other tenants, and you want to acquire tokens for a specific tenant.
Options passed-in to create the token acquisition object which calls into MSAL .NET.
member.returns: An access token to call the downstream API and populated with this downstream API's scopes.
member.remarks: Calling this method from a web API supposes that you have previously called, in a method called by JwtBearerOptions.Events.OnTokenValidated, the HttpContextExtensions.StoreTokenUsedToCallWebAPI method passing the validated token (as a JwtSecurityToken). Calling it from a web app supposes that you have previously called AddAccountToCacheFromAuthorizationCodeAsync from a method called by OpenIdConnectOptions.Events.OnAuthorizationCodeReceived.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition.RemoveAccountAsync(System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal,System.String)
member.summary: Removes the account associated with context.HttpContext.User from the MSAL.NET cache.
member.param: User
Authentication scheme. If null, will use OpenIdConnectDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web app, and JwtBearerDefault.AuthenticationScheme if called from a web API.
member.returns: A that represents a completed account removal operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Identity.Web.TokenAcquisition.BuildConfidentialClientApplication(Microsoft.Identity.Web.MergedOptions)
member.summary: Creates an MSAL confidential client application.
Gets an access token for a downstream API on behalf of the user described by its claimsPrincipal.
member.param: Claims principal for the user on behalf of whom to get a token.
Scopes for the downstream API to call.
(optional) TenantID based on a specific tenant for which to acquire a token to access the scopes on behalf of the user described in the claimsPrincipal.
Merged options.
Azure AD B2C user flow to target.
Options passed-in to create the token acquisition object which calls into MSAL .NET.

member.summary: Gets an access token for a downstream API on behalf of the user whose account is passed as an argument.
member.param: User IAccount for which to acquire a token. See .
Scopes for the downstream API to call.
TenantID based on a specific tenant for which to acquire a token to access the scopes on behalf of the user.
